newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-PERUGIA MUZZLE TEAM AFTER RUMBLINGS OF MUTINY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PERUGIA MUZZLE TEAM AFTER RUMBLINGS OF MUTINY.

text.p: Serie A newcomers Perugia muzzled their players on Sunday after rumblings of mutiny following their Italian Cup defeat by a part-time side.
A statement from the struggling club said the news blackout had been decided following "continual controversial statements which have appeared in certain newspapers".
It said only owner Luciano Gaucci was authorised to talk to the media and that it hoped the blackout would restore peace.

Perugia, promoted to the first division last season but lying fourth from bottom with just three points from four matches, crashed out of the second round of the cup last Wednesday 2-1 at home to serie C Nocerina.
The defeat denied Perugia a lucrative tie against European Cup holders Juventus and earned manager Giovanni Galeone a warning from Gaucci that he would be sacked if his record did not improve.

The players were also sent on a punitive training retreat ahead of next weekend's league match against Atalanta. One of them, Massimiliano Allegri, was expelled from the retreat on Friday after criticising the club's approach.
The team issued a statement on Saturday defending Allegri and saying they shared his views.
